definition[0]: the day when investors must pay for shares etc they have agreed to buy, often three working days after the original agreement
example[0]: The first dividend consists of the interest accrued  (=gained) from the settlement date to the first payment date.
definition[1]: the day when property or goods are sold and they legally belong to the buyer
example[1]: The contract allows the vendor  (=person selling something) to withdraw any time up to and including the settlement date.
